name: Maingau Hotel

reviews.text: Frankfurt is expensive. I think this hotel is a good option. It's in the applewine district, so there are lots of great restaurants nearby. Surprisingly, the museum area is also easily reachable on foot. Even the historic downtown we walked to crossing a nice pedestrian bridge. The subway and streetcar stops are nearby and we used them frequently to navigate around downtown and travel to the train station. Due to the number of bags we had, a taxi was the best option for travel to the airport.
reviews.title: Applewine!

likes.liked: — Easy access to historic downtown and train station. Plus the applewine!
likes.disliked: — Dated interior and lobby smells smokey.

reviews.text: The hotel is dated but certainly adequate. The surprise for us was the park across the street which had a playground. This was a great break for our seven year old. Be sure to ask for a park facing room.
reviews.title: Clean, Cheap, and Convenient

likes.disliked: — room size, but it was bigger than most European hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Maingu is a simple and clean hotel in the older part of Frankfurt. The location is great for walking to the central part of the city. We had two rooms there at the beginning of September--one for two people and one for three. Both were small, simple and clean. I'm not sure I would want to stay here if I were spending a lot of time in the room, but it was entirely adequate for the one night stopover we had. The included breakfast was great, and the staff helpful. Room prices were quite modest for Europe, making the hotel a bargain find at a time when the dollar is weak.
reviews.title: A most uncomfortable Night
Loved Staying at the Hotel Maingau
reviews.text: We stayed at the Maingau the night before our return flight. It was very hot, both in the room and out. We asked the front desk clerk, who seemed irritated to be interrupted from playing on the computer, if it would be possible to get a fan for the room. He said that he would look into it. We got the distinct impression that he wasn't about to look for a fan at all but was just pretending that he would to temporarily appease us.

When we returned, he said that he would continue to look for a fan, but we never heard another word from him. I carry a small thermometer/compass on my purse and it was 94 degrees in the room with NO air circulation. If the desk clerk would have been straight with us and told us that there were no fans, we would have gone out and bought one ourselves. That was the most uncomfortable night we have ever spent in a hotel.
reviews.title: Great wee hotel!
The only place we stay in Frankfurt
reviews.text: My husband is German and we travel to Germany usually at least once a year flying into Frankfurt. For eight years now, we've been staying at the Maingau as we come into and go out of the city and have always been pleased. It's a nice German-run hotel with a German flavor as opposed to all those chain hotels at the airport. And it's less expensive too. The restaurant is top for the inclusive breakfast or for dinner (which is extra). But there's a multitude of eateries within walking distance for authentic German cuisine. We recommend the Gemalte Haus. Distance to the airport is very "do-able". We take a taxi to and from. If you go, reserve in advance and be sure to ask for a non-smoking room or you will most likely get a room that smells like smoke, which can be unpleasant. Also, ask for a balcony. Bathrooms are generally small, but efficient. Parking is practically non-existent, but if you do have a car, let them know and they will usually arrange parking for you. However, you won't need a car once you are there. The longtime frontdesk manager at the hotel has recently retired (2003) and we have not been back since so not sure if everything is still run as efficiently as we have known it, but give it a try.

reviews.title: Wonderful for the Price!
reviews.text: The hotel staff here were all enormously friendly. In this small German hotel, they usually remembered my name and even my room number. My room was quite tiny, but very clean and very adequate for a trip when I really was only in the room at night to sleep. The shower and bathroom were small, and the sink was actually in the room, not in the tiny bathroom -- but the bed was comfortable, the water was warm, and the price was incredibly small. Breakfast each morning was delicious with a great variety of foods, and the restaurant in the hotel is outstanding. The hotel is in a pleasant residential neighborhood, and yet just a short walk across the bridge to the cathedral and the most scenic part of Frankfurt. There are delightful neighborhood restaurants within walking distance with wonderful food and great atmosphere. The other guests were mostly European, and I had the impression that some stayed there regularly. This is every bit as much a wonderful bargain as indicated in the Fodor Guide, and a great find for Fodor!

The Maingau is a good place to stay in Frankfurt. I feel like I could rely on it to be the same 5 years from now. The front desk staff seems to take a personal interest in the well-being of it's guests. They always went out of their way to help me find my way around the city and always remembered my name. I booked a double room. It was perhaps slightly smaller than I'd expected, but not too small. The bathroom was a bit tight in the toilet area, but the shower was ample and there was good water pressure and plenty of hot water. Rather than offer individual soaps and shampoos, the management chose to use an all-in-one shower gel attached to the wall (see photo). Its a matter of taste whether you like that. I think it's acceptable for a 3 star hotel, but prefer separate items. I thought the glasses in the bathroom were a bit thin and delicate. They could break easily. The bed was comfortable, with a nice comforter on it, and the pillows were wonderfully large. I found the room a bit warm. The room didn't have individual climate control, so it perhaps it could be much too warm in the summer. The large window opens, so I was able to get some air into the room and cool it down. That might not be so effective on a hot summer night. The hotel is in an appealing older residential district away from the highrises, on a park, and just 5 minutes walk to the banks of the Rhine. There are plenty of nearby restaurants and small shops around. There are a few convenience stores around, but not open at night. The closest tram and metro stops are 5 to 10 minutes walk from the hotel, so if you aren't a walker or have a lot of luggage, take a taxi to and from the train stations or airport. I was attending a trade show at the Messe, and the 16 tram (5 minutes walk) took me there in 15 minutes. One tip: book from a website like Venere.com if you can. It will be cheaper than booking over the phone. You can also compare the rate on the hotel website [--].
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay, very nice neighborhood

likes.liked: — Front desk staff, quiet, attractive neighborhood.
likes.disliked: — No individual climate control in room (a minor negative)

reviews.text: Stayed at the Maingau for 2 nights and had a wonderful stay. Great little hotel in a cool neighborhood. Lot's of bars and places to eat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Friendly helpful staff and you can't beat the rate. The rooms and building are a little old but they keep the property in great shape. Not many tourist attractions in Frankfurt but if you need a place to stay you could do a lot worse.
reviews.title: park and beyond
Great Loacation!
reviews.text: this is a gem of a hotel. It is in a residential neighbor across the street from a park. Parking can be difficult but they are very accommodating. Museums are close by. The Old
We stayed two nights at the Maingau.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.text: Really enjoyed our stay. Handy for the nightlife.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Loved the walks along the Main.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Maingau

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Maingau for one night. The location is in the historic Sachsenhausen area of Frankfurt. It was an easy walk from the Bahnhof to the hotel and then to the sights in the area. The room I had was very small, approximatley 120 to 150 square feet. It was very clean with a TV, shower, sink (outside the bathroom), closet and paper-thin walls. The hotel is not for the out of shape. There are many stairs, and the elevator is almost ineffective. The breaksfast is great.
reviews.title: Definately Recommended

description: The Maingau Hotel with its restaurant "Döpfner's im Maingau" wants to be your home abroad, making your stay as agreeable as possible, no matter whether you are on a business trip or on a privat holiday in Frankfurt.The 78 rooms with their modern style ambiance are all equipped with direct dial telephone, mini bar, satellite TV, internet access (W-LAN), bath or shower facilities, hairdryer and a working desk.The hotel has been managed by the owner’s family for over 60 years now.
